text: C'mon Bob from "Euro Drone Inc". At least pretend to have taken shots of the correct part of London from today
author: SimonNeville

text: “If 1m people come out on the streets in the future, then what government is going to say they are wrong now? When the last time the public expressed their opposition in that way, history said the people on the street were right & not the people in government” Lord Falconer, 2015
author: SimonNeville

text: The one that really gets me is the “Park Lane is so elitist”. It’s the laziest argument of all. If Hyde Park was full of helicopters dropping marchers off and Nigel Farage stops flying by private jet, then you might have a point
author: SimonNeville

text: Blah blah, democracy’s dying, blah, park lane’s v elite to have a march on, blah, look at that abusive sign, blah but 4m signatures, blah, why aren’t the BBC covering it, blah, millions were there [rinse and repeat]
author: SimonNeville

text: And if you don’t know who James Randi is, he’s an incredible individual https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Randi …
author: SimonNeville

text: With all this talk of the spoon bender today, it reminds me of a brilliant book I read on him a while ago. Well worth your time, if that’s your kind of thing. The Truth About Uri Geller by James Randi https://www.amazon.co.uk/Truth-About-Uri-Geller-ebook/dp/B005JS9QIA …
author: SimonNeville

text: Next you’ll be saying you’ll be voting for Corbyn...
author: SimonNeville

text: Fat chance
author: SimonNeville

text: I’ve lost track of what’s a “betrayal of the British people” now, now that we’re no longer leaving the EU on March 29th. Keen to get the message right tomorrow
author: SimonNeville

text: Sounds like a pigeon that’s lost its way... send someone with a Chuka mask on to scare him away
author: SimonNeville

text: Alas, until Twitter starts paying journalists for each sarcastic tweet they get sent by strangers, a bigger house will have to wait.
author: SimonNeville

text: Thanks Robbo. Glad you like my work and appreciate you keeping count
author: SimonNeville

text: “For The Many (unless they’re unelected nobodies), Not The Few” isn’t quite as catchy, tbh
author: SimonNeville

text:
List of people Corbyn will talk to:
Hezbollah 
Chuka Umunna
author: SimonNeville

text: Not a bad idea to have something to wake everyone up when she’s finished repeating herself. Again
author: SimonNeville

text: Go to the Rolls Building reception. If you’ve got a case number the desk staff are actually quite helpful if you play the “pity me” card. You can also search cases there too. If it’s a case in the Royal Courts of Justice, you’re screwed...
author: SimonNeville

text: Are we sure it was a comment to him in relation to Brexit and not because he was blocking the tube doors?
author: SimonNeville

text: Congrats Jess
author: SimonNeville

text: But I wanted a British No Deal Brexit, not a French-imposed one!
author: SimonNeville

text: 2 days for Apple to get a witty tweet signed off is probably the most impressive part tbh.
author: SimonNeville

text: Can confirm
author: SimonNeville

text: I think this v important debate shows just how necessary it still is to have the media and politics run by Oxbridge alumni
author: SimonNeville

text: Shareholders are told to reject Ocado chief's ‘excessive’ £100m bonus by influential advisory group
author: SimonNeville

text: B&M Bargains attempts to wriggle out of signing up to the Groceries Code Adjudicator’s rules on treating suppliers properly by taking the CMA to court
author: SimonNeville

text: The remain-supporting boss of Reed recruitment, James Reed, tells me why he’s moved his offices back to the UK because of Brexit
author: SimonNeville

text: If you call women “debauched” when you’re not angry, I’d hate to see you when you are. Mind how you go too
author: SimonNeville

text: Basically, I have never known a single PR firm ever publish a response from a journalist prior to publication of an article. It can ruin exclusives and  means hacks are unlikely to work or trust the company again. V unprofessional and petty
author: SimonNeville

text: May I suggest Tickled. Watched it last week. Still can’t get over it. Amazon Prime. https://www.amazon.co.uk/Tickled-David-Farrier/dp/B01MREEOXU …
author: SimonNeville
